class_notes:
Latin 201-1: Intermediate Latin: Prose (Fall 2021)
TuTh 11:30AM - 12:45PM
Barbara Lawatsch-Melton
Pre-requisite: Latin 101-102 sequence or its equivalent
Course Details:
Focusing on Apuleius' tale of Cupid and Psyche, this course develops proficiency in translating literary texts and an appreciation of Latin prose style.  It follows the Latin 101-102 sequence or its equivalent and also reviews selected topics in Latin grammar and syntax.
Required Book: Cupid and Psyche. An Adaptation from the Golden Ass of Apuleius, ed. M.G. Balme & J.H.W. Morwood  (Oxford U Press).  
Recommended: Latin dictionary, Latin textbook or reference grammar.
Grading
Two midterm tests, final exam; regular homework and class participation; several quizzes; a short presentation.
course_description: Fall. A review of grammar and an introduction to Latin prose through selections from one or more authors such as Caesar, Apuleius, and Livy.
